block.p: Wendy Elizabeth Perrin, the daughter of Lesley and Forrest Perrin of New York, was married yesterday to Timothy Arthur Baker, a son of Trudy and Arthur Baker of Petaluma, Calif. The Rev. Robert L. Ashworth, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Perrin family's home in Tucker, Ga.

The bride is the consumer news editor of Conde Nast Traveler magazine, for which she also writes the Perrin Report, a column. The bridegroom is a freelance photographer. They also have weekly columns on concierge.com, the Web site for Conde Nast Traveler; she is its consumer affairs columnist and he is the Europe columnist.

Wendy Elizabeth Perrin, the daughter of Lesley and Forrest Perrin of New York, was married yesterday to Timothy Arthur Baker, a son of Trudy and Arthur Baker of Petaluma, Calif. The Rev. Robert L. Ashworth, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Perrin family's home in Tucker, Ga.

The bride is the consumer news editor of Conde Nast Traveler magazine, for which she also writes the Perrin Report, a column. The bridegroom is a freelance photographer. They also have weekly columns on concierge.com, the Web site for Conde Nast Traveler; she is its consumer affairs columnist and he is the Europe columnist.

The bride, 35, is also the author of ''Wendy Perrin's Secrets Every Smart Traveler Should Know'' (Fodor's, 1997). She graduated cum laude from Harvard University. Her father is a pianist in New York who also arranges musical entertainment for social events. Her mother, who is known professionally as Lesley Davison, is a composer and lyricist.

The bridegroom, 47, was until recently a supervising national photography editor for The Associated Press. His mother, who is retired, was a substitute elementary school teacher in the Petaluma public schools. His father, also retired, was the director of Petaluma's water department.
